Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Optional: Crack bones with clean hammer or hatchet.

Ingredient.Name: Beef shin and knuckle bones
Ingredient.Notes: Trim any meat from bones and reserve.

Method.Step: Cut all the meat from the bones and save it. Rinse the meat and bones under cold running water, try to rub off as much visible blood as you can.
Place the bones in a kettle of cold water. Slowly bring the water to simmer, immediately skimming any of the gray scum which will accumulate at the surface.
Once the water begins to simmer, remove the pot from the heat and dump it into a clean sink. Rinse the bones under cold running water until they no longer feel slimy. Clean the simmering kettle.
Place the rinsed bones in the kettle. Add cold water, mirepoix, bouquet garni and spices.
Slowly bring the pot to a very, very slow simmer. Skim the scum from the surface of the stock and wipe any residue from the edge of the pot.
Cover and let it cook this way for at least 12 hours, checking it from time to time, always skimming any crud which accumulates at the surface.
Let it cool slightly, strain it and chill it until all of the residual fat hardens at the surface and can be removed.
Strain the stock again (line a colander or sieve with paper towels). Freeze it in pint containers, use as needed.
